item.title: Smart Meter Data Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: Synopsis On 13th December 2017 I attended a day of the IASC-ARS/68th Annual NZSA Conference. I attended a talk by Rob Hyndman on Probabilistic Outlier Detection And Visualization Of Smart Meter Data. Inspired by Rob Hyndmanâ€™s talk, I decided to perform an exploratory data analysis of smart meter data. There are a variety of open energy data resources.

item.title: Item without image
item.description: Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth.

item.title: Creating a website in hugo creative portfolio theme
item.description: There are a many tutorials and the great blogdown: Creating Websites with R Markdown with detailed steps on how to create a website using blogdown and Hugo. I found these extremely useful in setting up this site. I used the fantastic tutorial by Tyler Clavelle to create this blog. This website uses the blogdown R package and static site generator Hugo. I chose to use the hugo creative portfolio theme, with side bar and tiles layout.

item.title: Hello blog
item.description: Welcome to my personal blog and portfolio of my data science journey. I started coding in March 2017 and until now I have been creating and publishing R code to github and HTML to RPubs. I also have a Wordpress professional website to also reach out to both technical and non-technical audiences with summaries of projects. I realised I needed another more personalised medium to easily publish the detailed code and HTML from projects so I created this blog.

item.title: Hello blog
item.description: Welcome to my personal blog and portfolio of my data science journey. I started coding in March 2017 and until now I have been creating and publishing R code to github and HTML to RPubs. I also have a Wordpress professional website to also reach out to both technical and non-technical audiences with summaries of projects and interactive objects. I realised I needed another more personalised medium to publish the detailed code and HTML from projects so I created this blog.
